## CES-D vs HCL-32

Harmony a generative AI tool specifically developed for psychologists and social scientists, is an ideal tool when it comes to comparing two frequently used instruments in psychology, the CES-D and HCL-32. These two different tests, both important tools in understanding mental health, often need to be compared in studies, creating the need to address the CES-D vs HCL-32 conundrum. Harmony uses large-scale language models to compare the two scales effectively and provides a percentage match between items in both scales. 



{{< image src="/images/gad7-becks.jpg" alt="CES-D vs HCL-32" title="CES-D vs HCL-32" >}}

{{< card heading="Try Harmony" copy="Compare CES-D and HCL-32 " url="https://harmonydata.ac.uk/app" >}}

{{< youtube cEZppTBj1NI >}}




Using Harmony's user-friendly and intuitive interface, researchers can drag and drop their own CES-D or HCL-32 instruments in PDF form, whether for individual or multi-language studies, easing the process of comparison. Harmony's database also includes these instruments, which means the process can start right away. With CES-D vs HCL-32 being a common comparison in psychological studies, Harmony provides a much-needed solution to make the harmonisation process less time-consuming and more accurate.




## Compare the items in CES-D English and HCL-32

* <a href="https://harmonydata.ac.uk/app/#" target="harmonyapp">Import CES-D and HCL-32 into Harmony and harmonise them</a> - find similarities between the two instruments using our AI platform
* <a href="https://harmonydata.ac.uk/app/#" target="harmonyapp">Import just CES-D into Harmony</a> - compare CES-D English with other instruments
* <a href="https://harmonydata.ac.uk/app/#" target="harmonyapp">Import just HCL-32 into Harmony</a> - compare HCL-32 with other instruments


Harmony's advanced technology can drastically improve the process of comparing CES-D vs HCL-32, while aiding in complex longitudinal and cohort studies. It saves valuable time through its efficient methods of harmonisation, can handle multiple languages, and offers precise comparisons within an easy to use web interface. With CES-D vs HCL-32 harmonisation assisted by Harmony, researchers can focus more on the results and their implications on understanding mental health.
